brief_summary.textblock: A prospective observational study of the incidence of treatment-requiring ROP (TR-ROP), at a national level, in Greece.

detailed_description.textblock: The purpose of this observational study is to prospectively collect data on ROP cases necessitating treatment at a national level. Each and every ROP screening unit in Greece (collaborating centers) report their new TR-ROP cases, their demographics and treatment characteristics, monthly, for a 12-month period. A reminder email is sent to avoid under-reporting due to neglect. Data are collected by the Responsible Party and will be analyzed together with national registry data on all preterm births in the same 12-month period.

primary_outcome.measure: The incidence of treatment-requiring ROP (TR-ROP) in Greece
primary_outcome.time_frame: During the study period (1 year, prospectively)

secondary_outcome.measure: The mean gestational age and birth weight of infants treated for ROP in Greece
secondary_outcome.time_frame: During the study period (1 year, prospectively)

secondary_outcome.measure: The rate of participants treated with laser photocoagulation versus anti-VEGF injection
secondary_outcome.time_frame: During the study period (1 year, prospectively)

secondary_outcome.measure: The failure and recurrence rate of applied treatments for ROP
secondary_outcome.time_frame: During the follow-up period (6 months from treatment, prospectively)

study_pop.textblock: All preterm infants who underwent treatment for ROP in a public or private hospital in Greece during the 12-month study period.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Preterm infants undergoing screening for ROP, who developed TR-ROP and were treated for ROP in one or two eyes.
Exclusion Criteria:
- None.
